greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} phi(d)^2.
comment: Equals the inverse Mobius transform (A051731) of A127473. [_Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 20 2008]
Number of (i,j) in {1,2,..,n}^2 such that gcd(n,i)=gcd(n,j). [_Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 31 2020]
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} phi(k)^2*x^k/(1 - x^k), where phi(k) is the Euler totient function (A000010). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 16 2017
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} phi(n/gcd(n, k)). - _Ridouane Oudra_, Nov 28 2019
maple: with(numtheory): A029939 := proc(n) local i,j; j := 0; for i in divisors(n) do j := j+phi(i)^2; od; j; end;
for d from 2 to N do
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := (p^(2*e)*(p-1)+2)/(p+1); a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 18 2020 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, eulerphi(d)^2); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 17 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
